item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Valve releases Team Fortress 2 game code (845 points | 206 comments)
2. Meta announces LlamaCon, its first generative AI dev conference on April 29 (39 points | 11 comments)
3. A year of uv: pros, cons, and should you migrate (146 points | 63 comments)
4. HP Acquires Humane's AI Software (69 points | 49 comments)
5. Kafka at the low end: how bad can it get? (47 points | 21 comments)
6. Show HN: Scripton – Python IDE with built-in realtime visualizations (321 points | 110 comments)
7. Grim Fandango Puzzle Document (1996) [pdf] (31 points | 2 comments)
8. One year after switching from Java to Go (83 points | 61 comments)
9. XOR (204 points | 28 comments)
10. Launch HN: Promptless (YC W25) – Automatic updates for customer-facing docs (52 points | 27 comments)
11. Are LLMs able to play the card game Set? (23 points | 13 comments)
12. Pi-hole v6 (348 points | 183 comments)
13. Migraine is more than a headache – a rethink offers hope (61 points | 73 comments)
14. Converge (YC S23) is hiring engineer #2 in NYC ( | hide)
15. File Pilot: A file explorer built for speed with a modern, robust interface (79 points | 20 comments)
16. Nuclear fusion: WEST beats the world record for plasma duration (230 points | 202 comments)
17. My LLM codegen workflow (266 points | 83 comments)
18. Tensor evolution: A framework for fast tensor computations using recurrences (37 points | 5 comments)
19. South Korean regulator accuses DeepSeek of sharing user data with ByteDance (152 points | 70 comments)
20. Show HN: A GPU-accelerated binary vector index (36 points | 4 comments)
21. Why I'm writing a Scheme implementation in 2025: Async Rust (176 points | 68 comments)
22. Making my debug build run 100x faster so that it is finally usable (50 points | 12 comments)
23. Try thinking and learning without working memory (2008) (104 points | 54 comments)
24. Alice Hamilton Waged a One-Woman Campaign to Get the Lead Out of Everything (4 points | discuss)
25. Building an Open, Multi-Engine Data Lakehouse with S3 and Python (45 points | 7 comments)
26. Among top researchers 10% publish at unrealistic levels, analysis finds (142 points | 91 comments)
27. Programming with chronic pain (102 points | 44 comments)
28. Saying goodbye to FFmpegKit (137 points | 77 comments)
29. Kleene as a Container Management Platform for FreeBSD (41 points | 8 comments)
30. Catalytic computing taps the full power of a full hard drive (52 points | 12 comments)
